results.title: 7 plus seven
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Fourteen children from a variety of school backgrounds, interviewed in 1964 for television about their hopes and aspirations, are followed up seven years later. Extracts from the first program, made when the children were seven years old, are shown and the children comment on any changes in their ideas.

results.title: 7 Days in September
results.creator_credit: Steven Rosenbaum and Broadcast News Networks
results.brief_description: This moving, if rudimentarily filmed documentary, is a collective account of ‘September 11, 2001’ and that day’s impact on a variety of New Yorkers. The filmmakers utilise an array of original footage shot over that week by professionals and by amateurs; they also interview an array of people who lived in New York at the time who describe their own responses and the unusual occurrences witnessed. The narrative focuses on the feel in New York over the week: the mood on the street, impromptu prayer sessions that were conducted, for example, as well as debates that raged between strangers; the clean up effort and the way that people pulled together, helping each other, making donations, giving blood, and providing emotional support. Whilst in no way an analysis of the calamity, the filmmakers eloquently capture the small stories. The work in a minor way, also addresses the role and the dilemma of any documentary filmmaker caught up in a tragedy - to film or not to film and at what stage does observation of a grand-scale catastrophe cross over into exploitation and opportunism.

results.title: 7 Colours
results.creator_credit: John Rogowski, Paul Humfress and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Seven short dance pieces which are designed to create the mood of the colour each segment represents. As well as the colour, each dance uses another motif, such as a geometric shape or a concept such as Yin and Yang to complement or emphasise the colour mood. The music was composed by Guy Gross for the choreographers and dancers, Victoria Taylor and Stephen Page.

results.title: 64,000,000 years ago
results.creator_credit: Bill Maylone, John Taylor, George Johnson, Pacific Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This short animated film for children looks at the last of the great dinosaurs to stalk the central plains of North America. Lifelike models of ornithomimus, edmontosaur, and triceratops recreate the late Cretaceous period, offering a view of how our world may have looked 64,000,000 years ago. The soundtrack is filled with growls and roars with the occassional voice-over narration.

results.title: 60 second spot: the making of a television commercial
results.creator_credit: Harvey Mandlin, Dotty Mandlin and Mandlinfilm
results.brief_description: Traces the steps taken in creating and shooting a television commercial. Shows the cooperation between the advertising agency, the independent producer, and the individuals making the film, including the producer, director and actors. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: 60 cycles [French version]
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Labrecque and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The 11th. St Laurent long distance cycling race with participants from 13 countries covers 1500 miles of the Quebec countryside in 12 days. From a distance, the cyclists are a moving colour frieze against the picturesque landscape; closer we see the taut faces and straining limbs of the competitiors above the bright circle of their machines.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean-Claude Labrecque and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: 60 cycles
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Labrecque, Jacques Bobet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The 11th St. Laurent long-distance cycle race; with participants from thirteen countries; and fifteen hundred miles of Quebec countryside to cover in twelve days. From a distance the cyclists are a moving colourful frieze against the picturesque landscape; closer, we see the taut faces and straining limbs of the competitors above the bright circles of their machines. (Awards: Moscow, London, Prague, New York, Cork)

results.title: 60's Rock Legends
results.creator_credit: Peter Clifton, World Film Services and John Heyman
results.brief_description: During the second half of the sixties and into the seventies, Peter Clifton took his cameras and crew from Hyde Park to the Paris Olympia. He was afforded a rare insight into the inner workings of the most explosive phase of rock history. The video includes clips from the Rolling Stones, Jimi Hendrix, Pink Floyd and many more.
